benchmark_details.name: BIS (Prompt Importance Sampling)
benchmark_details.overview: BIS is a novel evaluation framework that enables ground-truth-free prediction of LLM performance on code generation tasks by analyzing prompt distributions, rather than executing generated code. It leverages importance sampling theory and Importance Weighted Autoencoders (IWAE).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide an efficient and cost-effective framework for evaluating the performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) on code generation tasks without the need for human-annotated ground truth.

data.source: Prompt distributions from existing annotated benchmarks and performance metrics from the CodeLlama models.

methodology.calculation: Error rates calculated as the prediction minus the actual performance.
methodology.interpretation: Performance metrics provide a measure of the quality of code generated by LLMs.
methodology.baseline_results: Average absolute error for code correctness scores was 1.1%.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments were conducted across multiple CodeLlama models and diverse benchmarks.
